channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2025050498
item.description:
Report X-2025050498

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS SENT TO AUTOMATED SORTING SYSTEM IN ERROR. PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM SORTING BELT AND SENT DOWN CHUTE THAT CAUSED INTERIOR CONTAINER TO SHATTER. EMPLOYEE WHO NEXT HANDLED PACKAGE WAS INJURED FROM CHEMICAL. ALL SPILT LIQUID WAS THEN CLEANED UP BY DESIGINATED RESPONDERS USING SODIUM BI CARBONATE. ALL SPILL MATERIAL DEBRIS WAS CONTAINERIZED AND EMPLOYEE WHO ATTEMPTED TO DISPOSED OF DEBRIS WAS ALSO INJURED FROM EXPOSURE. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS THEN CALLED FOR CLEANUP.

item.title: Report E-2025040578
item.description:
Report E-2025040578

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: CAMP HILL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift driver was loading a short skid and did not recognize that his fork blade was poking out from the back side of the pallet. As he went to place the pallet, he forked the bottom the the jerrican. Hazwoper trained personnel immediately responded to the spill. Spill pads were put down to absorb the spilled adhesive material. The damaged jerrican was placed in an overpack. All spill clean up materials were placed in a separate overpack in preparation for disposition.

Upon unloading the truck the following week it was discovered that one of the drums had reacted, causing the drum to fail and approximately 4oz of material to be leaked into the cargo portion of the truck. item.title: Report E-2025040643
item.description:
Report E-2025040643

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: DONALSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 04/16/2025, at 19:19 hours, CSX personnel, reported train M64515 transporting car FURX 894276 (Load, Crude Zinc Oxide) was leaking a white material from a hole in the bottom of the hopper car. The reported location was mile post AN 753.00 on the Dothan subdivision, near the Fox Lane crossing, in Donalsonville, GA. The initial cause of the release was damage to the hopper body which has resulted from mechanical failure of the car's truck assembly. Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the incident. Upon arrival, contractor personnel confirmed two wheel burns to the hopper body which resulted in product spillage. Contractor personnel patched the holes, and the car was held pending unloading or movement under OTMA.

  • City: LOWELL

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. The paint dried so Dayton Freight personnel did not need to deploy granular absorbents to the impacted area. They gathered the damaged pail and containerized it into one (1) 8-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: While unloading freight, the spill was identified. Dock leadership was notified and a HAZWOPER trained employee was tasked with clean up. Investigation revealed that the original loader of the trailer had pushed pallets in behind the drums resulting in damage to the drum and a spill. Spill X powder was used to neutralize the liquid. The drum was placed in an overpack in preparation for disposition and to control any more spillage. All remnants of the spill were cleaned up placed in a separate overpack.

item.title: Report X-2025041745
item.description:
Report X-2025041745

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Supervisor states that checker Emzer Caston was loading trailer 504741 when his rear tire slipped on a dock bumper and pushed him forward into a shipment of UN3082, ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S. (POLYAMINE RESIN), 9, PG III, MARINE POLLUTANT which completely punctured the 5 5 gallon drum and is actively spilling from the trailer onto the yard. ABF Supervisor states that about 20 gallons or so has spilled into the yard and that rain is in the forecast around 11PM (EST) tonight for Atlanta. Safety advised to block off the premise of the spill and try their best to stop t he spill from entering any drains. ABF Supervisor states that deployed snakes to stop the spill from spreading on the yard. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a cleanup crew on emergency response to the terminal. FCE personnel collected two (2) damaged 55-gallon drums and placed in two (2 ) overpacks for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and concrete yard beneath the trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, FCE personnel utilized a cleaning agent and absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted s urfaces. All UN3082 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2)55-gallon drums and ABF personnel took possession of the waste for terminal disposal. FCE personnel noted no further actions required on-site and crews demobilized.

  • Description: As the jerrican were being unloaded the unloader noticed one of the jerrican was leaking. The pallet they were shipped on had cardboard dunnage on it for protection, but a loose nail protruding from the pallet poked through and punctured the jerrican. Once the leak was noticed, leadership was immediately notified. HAZWOPER trained personnel flipped the jerrican over to stop the leak. 3b putty was placed on the jerrican and allowed to cure. Once cured, the pail was placed in an overpack drum in preparation for disposition.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8700
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver noticed material on the tire of his trailer during his pre-trip inspection. The driver immediately stopped the leak from the drum. A spill response contractor was called to the location of the trailer, since the driver did not have the equipment needed to remove the leaking drum from the trailer. The spill contractor found the leaking drum, removed it from the trailer, placed the leaking drum into an overpack, and then cleaned up the material on the inside and outside of the trailer. The overpack was placed back in the trailer. A minimal amount of material, less than 1 gallon, was released below the trailer. The rest of the material was contained to the inside of the trailer. Upon observation of the drum, it looks like there was a very small puncture in the side of the drum.

item.title: Report X-2025041732
item.description:
Report X-2025041732

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, Hub personnel reported that unit RNLU 100108 was leaking a blue liquid that had seeped through the container floor, resulting in a spill of less than 1 gallon of product onto the ground. An interior inspection of the cargo inside revealed a mixed load of hazardous materials palletized and (Printer Ink) in 55 gallon drum on the floor of the container towards the rear of the container. The pallets were stowed two rows wide, stacked two high. The load was secured using a 4x4 foot piece of lumber nailed into a 40"x48" pallet at the rear of the container. A 55 gallon drum containing printer ink, classified as a Class 3 Flammable Hazardous Material, was discovered leaking inside a container positioned on railcar FEC 72198. Upon inspection, it was determined that approximately 25 gallons of ink had been released inside the container and onto the interior of the railcar. Further examination of the drum revealed two cracks at the bottom, which were identified as the source of the leak.

  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank when a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the storage tank and hose adaptor to become compromised and approximately 50 gallons of gasoline was released. Fulton County Hazmat responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When our driver started unloading product was pouring out of the QRB assembly. he shut down but by the time pressure came off the line there was 10 gallons that spilled, 3 of which went in to the catch bucket and 7 on the ground. When they pulled it back to the operating center and inspected it with safety representatives they found that the external valve quick release bonnet had been disassembled incorrectly.

item.title: Report E-2025040455
item.description:
Report E-2025040455

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: CHASKA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our driver hooked up his hose to begin the offloading of anhydrous ammonia into a refrigeration system. Once the hose was hooked up, the driver started pumping the liquid ammonia. After starting the pump, the driver noticed a small leak at the hose connection. The driver then attempted to fix the leak with out shutting the pump off and putting on his PPE. While tightening the connection he moved the nozzle on the hose causing an aerosol of ammonia that traveled past his face which caused eye irritation due to not having goggles on. The duration of the leak was less than one minute and the release was fixed by getting the hose nozzle tightened at the connection.

item.title: Report E-2025040620
item.description:
Report E-2025040620

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver pulled a tanker out of the SJ facility while the dome lid was still partially open. This caused some of the tanker contents to spill out in the SJ Facility yard and onto the street (Berryessa Rd). SJ Technician loaded the tanker but didn't close the lid before the driver proceeded to leave the facility. SJ Technician saw liquid spilling from the tanker when the driver was still heading onto the public roadway. Another employee pulled next to the truck to advise of the leak. immediately discovered the dome lid was not closed. Dome lid was properly closed and secured. Team proceeded to report the spill and start the cleanup.

item.description:
Report X-2025041705

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: Portland - Clackamas
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6th, 2024 the PTRC reported to BNSF SID that the CBTX 742660 was found by ODOT Hazmat inspector to be leaking vapor through the vacuum relief valve (VRV). BNSF mobilized contractors to the car to inspect. Upon inspection it was found that vapors were releasing through the VRV. Contractors removed the leaking VRV and applied a 2.5" plug in its place and confirmed the car was no longer leaking. The shipper applied for and received an OTMA so the car could continue to destination. Only vapors were observed to have released and no cleanup was necessary as vapors dissipated. Volumes reported are based upon responders observations and are estimates only.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking plastic tote containing hazardous product, Trimeta Boost. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimate 1-cup release onto the top of the plastic tote in a 2 x 2 area as a result of a lose / faulty cap. The contractor replaced the broken cap with a new cap and performed a slosh test to ensure that no further leakage would occur in transit. No waste was generated from this response and the tote will ship on to the Consignee. No soil, storm-drains, or waterways were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: CONTENTS OF ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE TRIGGER TERM OF IPHONES VISIBLE ON GREEN TAPE AFFIXED TO THE OUTER CASE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE IPHONES AND TWO POWER BANKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PELICAN CASE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM AN UNKNOWN CUSTOMER AND LOCATION IN WISCONSIN. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING THE CONSIGNEES ACCOUNT NUMBER 018821, ESPN, 545 MIDDLE ST, BRISTOL CT 06010-8413. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: On April 28, 2025, two (2) 4-gallon pails of Epoxy Primer 1:1 Part B were crushed and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the crew utilized absorbents to remediate the trailer interior. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

R + L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: MILWAUKEE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 23, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1908 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 30-gallon drums.

  • City: CERES

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the drum lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the drum and wiped it with absorbents. The impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum after the lid was tightened for future shipment.

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a spill agent was called for a leaking shipment. The spill agent didn't see any signs of a release but the shipment was warm to the touch. While investigating the shipment they found two lithium batteries inside packaged with styrofoam for dunnage. One battery was melted and extremely warm to the touch. Both batteries were placed into steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2025040534
item.description:
Report E-2025040534

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: KUTZTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-10ft area of concrete and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material were released due to forklift damaging one (1) poly tote. Hepaco personnel used Soda Ash to neutralize Hydrochloric acid. Contractor personnel deployed granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the affected areas. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged drum to a new poly tote. The impacted absorbents were containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. Impacted PPE was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut up and was put in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted plywood was put in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drums were staged onsite. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/15/2025 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3962863 at the station location in Madison, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one polystyrene box that contained dry ice. The shipment was discovered having the distinct rattling and being cold to touch. Further investigation revealed that package confirm the suspicions of dry ice. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. Due to delicate nature of the medication being shipped, the shipper was contacted the retrieved the shipment.

item.title: Report E-2025040651
item.description:
Report E-2025040651

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: RIVERTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:03 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XSF. It was reported that an unknown amount of an unknown hazard class 2.3 released from one compressed gas canister due to currently unknown reasons. The release impacted Trailer #3171296 which is located in the yard, close to Dock #38. Contractor stated that there was condensation on the cylinders and some residual product in the cylinders. After speaking with the Shipper, they were informed that the cylinders shipped as empty, but that they do not bleed them empty, so residual is possible. Wally's team found 7 cylinders that weren't closed properly that could have contributed to the hissing that XPO was hearing. The contractor's dragar tubes did provide some detections low in the trailer and those readings will be provided to us, momentarily. They used simple green to clean the trailer floor. A crew member will be returning to the sire to overpack the PAIL of impacted absorbents and the contractor will be billing for the SCBA refills.

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-13
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/12/2025 at approximately 0350, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4155356 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 7 containers of acrylic paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment emitted a urethane odor, requiring further inspection, searching for a potential leak. While no contents leaked, the inspection did result in the discovery of undeclared paint. The accompanying safety data sheet classified the commodity as nonregulated, which does not appear to be correct. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04-10-2025 a CN mechanical performing an inbound inspection of train M-33891-09 observed vapor emitting from the valve area of TILX 112000.The employee notified the Dangerous Goods Team and made internal emergency notifications per the CN ERP. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival found vapor coming from the air valve. The blind flange was not applied, and the valve was cracked open. The liquid line also had the shipper supplied loading fitting still applied. The fitting did not have a cap on. The air valve was closed, and the blind flange was reapplied. On the liquid line the shippers fitting was removed, and the blind flange was reapplied. The tank cars pressure plate was cleaned by the CN Dangerous Goods Team.

Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. One (1) 90-gallon poly drum was used to contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 09:30 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XDP) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .5 gallon of NQ Solve 1110 (hazardous - UN2059) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged lids, and oil-dri will be placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The 2 lids of the damaged drums will be replaced and sealed to move on to the Consignee. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Alex (Chemtrec) who provided report #2025032600102.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:56 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XDM. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of VM&P Naphtha released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to improper packaging. The release impacted trailer #3193050. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste labels 231649-1 and 231649-2 were created, one 65-gallon metal drum containing one 55-gallon metal drum and one 55-gallon metal drum containing one broken down wooden pallet. CHEMTREC was notified of the release, report #2025032500101 was given by Charles.

item.title: Report E-2025040551
item.description:
Report E-2025040551

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:16 on 3/26, XPO-XLA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 gallons of "Sikadur Hex 300" from a 5gal metal pail onto the trailer and dock floors. The pail was crushed against another piece of freight at LTU. ERTS confirmed the product to be a class 8 corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. ERTS reported the spill to Chemtrec and spoke to Esta who provided the report number: 2025032500019. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed the entire 1.2-gallon of UN2735 Sikadur Hex 300 released to 4x8 area of the wooden trailer floor. The floor was scrubbed with water and the pH strip test was completed showing a pH of 8. The waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was loaded for store in Springville, UT. While on I-15 southbound lane the Driver struck a piece of road debris that was a metal rod at MM 275. Driver was in middle lane and could not avoid the object. When the object was struck it was thrown into his passenger side fuel tank on the truck creating a hole in this fuel tank. Driver pulled over to check the equipment and realized the fuel tank was leaking. Solar dispatched Environmental Restoration LLC to begin clean up. The diesel tank on the truck was full roughly 100 gallons released on the side of the I-15. Estimated 30 gallons impacted a drain along I-15 the other gallons stayed on concrete and was able to be collected via absorbent material. Environmental Restoration dispatched a Vac truck and Jet Rodder to clean the lines of the drain system. This clean up generated three 55-gallon drums of absorbent and impacted debris as well as the contents of the Vac truck.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On March 6, 2024 GATX 73828 was shipped from Dyno Nobel in Carthage, MO to Cornerstone Chemical in Westwego, LA. This was the final destination and Cornerstone Chemical received the car and maintained possession of it during the period of March through August 2024, and until the incident was mitigated. On August 7, 2024, Cornerstone Chemical was moving the car inside their facility, when employees discovered a pinhole leak near the top of the tank. Cornerstone Chemical notified the NRC and initiated a hazardous materials response and cleanup. Cornerstone Chemical contracted with third-party companies to transfer the remaining contents from the tank car and cleanup the spill. The tank car was scrapped. On April 5, 2025, Dyno Nobel received a letter from PHMSA instructing Dyno to submit a hazardous materials incident report.

  • Description: On 7/22/2025 @1100ct Altom Transport was at our facility to load out solvent and when everything was connected and ready to pump into there tanker the line pressurised and the material did not flow into the tanker. The line broke due to the increased pressure causing approximately 50 gallons of material to be released onto the containment pad. There was no soil or water ways impacted the material was completely contained on the containment pad at the loading area. The immediately called for our internal response team and was able to reclaim and wipe up the material with absorbents that were disposed of properly. The clean up was completed by 1300ct.

item.title: Report E-2025040470
item.description:
Report E-2025040470

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: Rexburg
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6187
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 16, 2024, at 9:30am, Kenan Advantage Group truck and LNG trailer arrived at the Rexburg LNG Facility. IGC Vaporization Technicians (Vap Tech) began preparation for offload. The LNG trailer pressure was increased to approximately 60 psig, the transfer hose was connected to the LNG trailer, the purge valve at the truck Offloading Skid was opened and the hose was purged. At 10:10am, the Vap Tech slightly opened the LNG trailer fill and drain valve. Vapor and LNG began to release from the vent stack at the back of the LNG trailer. The Vap Tech immediately left the hazardous area and attempted to relieve pressure from the LNG trailer, as it was initially believed the LNG was being released from the LNG trailer relief valve. The emergency shutdown (ESD) at the back of the LNG trailer was in the hazardous area and not accessible. At 10:15am, a local methane detector at the Offloading Skid alarmed and initiated an emergency shutdown. At 10:35am, the Vap Tech pushed a secondary ESD, located near the front of the trailer, to close the fire blocks on the LNG trailer. The fire blocks did not shut off and stop the release of LNG resulting in the LNG flowing into the concrete spill pit at the facility. At 10:45am, the Fire Department arrived onsite, and evacuations began at 11:30am. Seventeen (17) residential buildings (approximately 30 people) were evacuated. The Vap Techs continued to monitor the atmosphere with gas detectors from a safe distance. At 2:54pm, the area was deemed safe, and the Vap Techs shut in the system. At 3:30pm, the evacuations were lifted. At 4:47pm, the Rexburg LNG Facility was returned to normal operation. Upon incident investigation, it was discovered when the fill and drain valve was slightly opened, the LNG flowed through the fill line bleed valve on the LNG trailer, into the vent piping, and sprayed out of the vent stack. The fill line bleed should have been verified to be closed before opening the fill and drain valve. It was also discovered that the secondary failure of the fire block valve not closing caused the LNG to continue to release into the concrete spill pit.

  • City: RUTLAND

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At or about 2045 hrs on 9 July 2024 a hydrostatic valve failed on a nurse tank owned by Pro Cooperative in the town of Rutland Iowa causing the release of 70 gallons of Anhydrous Ammonia into the atmosphere (360.5 Lbs, RQ of 100 Lbs). The Humboldt County Sherrif and Emergency Coordinator were called and the HAZMAT team was dispatched at or about 2050 hrs, 9 July, 2024. The HAZMAT Team closed the valve, the Sherriff Department cordoned the area and restricted access while evacuating some residents and advising all others to shelter in place until the vapor dissipated.

item.description:
Report E-2025040503

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: PALM CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, thirty-six (36) pails of hydrochloric acid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the asphalt and utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in four (4) 85-gallon overpacks and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2025040471

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEVA FREIGHT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, at 1513 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by CEVA Logistic personnel in Miami, FL regarding the release of Aprosolve Methanol. The spill consisted of approximately 1 ounce of Aprosolve Methanol (UN1230, 3, II), which leaked from 1-5 gallon metal drum and impacted a concrete dock. CEVA personnel stated the consignee refused the freight. The damaged drum was returned to the terminal where they advised they will place the damaged drum, remaining waste inside, and oil-dri into a 55-gallon DF for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twelve (12) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a manufacturing defect at the bottom of the drum that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2025, one (1) 50-gallon cylinder of UN2401 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew secured the valve, then utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040458
item.description:
Report E-2025040458

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 50-Gallon DM containing hazardous product, ROCRYL 410. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 20-gallon release onto the entire wooden trailer floor and concrete beneath the trailer in a 12 x 10 area as a result of a clamp puncture during the off-loading process. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and used absorbents pads to clean the trailer. One 85-gallon DF containing the overpacked damaged leaking was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DM containing impacted oil dry and absorbent pads was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report X-2025041283

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Upon notification I was conferenced in with Mr. Ainsworth, who reported that the hump crew found the car leaking in the bowl. Mechanical was contacted to assess and secure the door. Mechanical found the door partially open with a slow steady stream coming from the door. The door was secured, and the release stopped. Code 3 was contacted and responded and found multiple small piles on the bowl track. Track time was set up for 4/18/25 and two cubic yard bags was recovered by hand. LSB Industries has agreed to accept the collected material. The car is in HZ hold awaiting an OTMA-1 and then it will be shipped back to LSB in El Dorado.

item.title: Report X-2025041123
item.description:
Report X-2025041123

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/16/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 832024 at the station location in Roseville, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained two stuffed teddy bears and other Easter-themed decorations. The shipment was discovered by the K-9 unit during the location's screening procedure. Further investigation resulted in the discovery of a disassembled AR-15 rifle and a loaded magazine cartridge that was found inside one of the teddy bears. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSEs) to remediate the site. Crews deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spend absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) quarts of material released from three (3) 1-quart metal cans from one (1) box due to a forklift accident that resulted in the cans being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged containers were contained into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On April 15, 2025, one (1) 6-gallon pail of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail and impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5105681 at the station location in Kansas City, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered emitting a strong odor at the facility. Further investigation revealed that paint had spilled inside of its inner packaging and contained. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. All measurements mentioned in this report are estimated due to the missing information.

item.title: Report X-2025040969
item.description:
Report X-2025040969

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING HAZMAT INSIDE THE TRAILER. RESPONDER ARRVIED WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS NO OUTSIDE SPILLAGE OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE, NO ZEP ZORBENT WAS NEEDED. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DISPOSAL FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS INTO GREEN BAGS. RESPONDER THEN DECONTAMINATED ALL PPE.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING AN ALCOHOL-LIKE ODOR BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND EVACUATED THE AREA. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 4-LITER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APROXIMATELY 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO A SIDEWALL OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report X-2025041011
item.description:
Report X-2025041011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM A FEEDER ONTO THE IRREGULAR CONVEYOR BELT WHEN THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS ID8000 CONSUMER COMMODITY WITH AN APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER, LTD QTY MARK, AND CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABEL. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THERE ARE THREE X 500ML GLASS BOTTLES SET IN INDIVIDUALLY WHITE CARTONS SET INSIDE A LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG. THERE ARE TEN X 100ML BOTTLES IN ANOTHER LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG THAT DID NOT LEAK. THERE WAS WADDED CRAFT PAPER ABOVE AND BELOW THE BAGGED CARTONS. ALL INNER CARTONS AND POLY BAGS HAD BECOME SOILED BY THE COLOGNE AFTER ONE OF THE 500ML BOTTLES HAD SHATTERED. THE OUTER BOX APPEARED TO BE NEW OR LIKE-NEW 12 X 12 X 12 WITH A 44 ECT ON THE BOTTOM BOX SEAL.

item.title: Report X-2025041330
item.description:
Report X-2025041330

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04-05-2025 a CN mechanical performing an inbound inspection of train M-34241-05 observed frost on the protective housing of tank car # SHPX 222262 along with a strong Propane type odor in the area. The employee notified the Dangerous Goods Team and made internal emergency notifications per the CN ERP. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival and inspection found icing on the 2# B end liquid valve. It was found that the valve handle was not in the fully closed position. The plug was also found to be less than tool tight allowing product to leak out. The 2# Vapor valve was also found to be leaking due to the valve handle not being in the fully closed position and the securement plug was less than tool tight. Air monitoring readings on top of the car were below actionable levels with the highest LEL (Lower Explosive Limit) reading sitting at an 8%. PPE was FR Clothing and based on the Air monitoring readings on top of the car no raspatory protection was worn. Both the 2" B end liquid valve and vapor valve were closed stopping the release. The plug was removed allowing the residual product to vent and the valve to thaw. The securement was confirmed with an air monitor which showed non detect. The securement plug was then installed

item.title: Report E-2025040467
item.description:
Report E-2025040467

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material, along with PPE, and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. One (1) 5-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040502
item.description:
Report E-2025040502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-22
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the asphalt parking lot 20ft-by-5ft of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to hard brake incident that caused a load shift resulting in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum becoming crushed. First Call Environmental personnel deployed neutralizers to the impacted areas and then used a granular absorbent to recover the neutralized material. The remaining product in the damaged drum was neutralized and containerized along with the recovered spent material into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged empty drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040487
item.description:
Report E-2025040487

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: BRISTOL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the, observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 53ft-by-5ft of the trailer floor and the asphalt parking lot estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and gathered the spent materials. The recovered absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one metal drum. The impacted trailer floor and asphalt were pressure-washed to remove the staining, and the rinse water was collected and containerized into one additional 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040396
item.description:
Report E-2025040396

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0217 ET, UKC notified ERTS of a cargo release inside trailer 3152579. It was reported 4 ounces of Brake Flush VOC released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading from BAT. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported the spill will be cleaned with oil dri and placed into a 5-gallon poly bucket. The damaged drum itself will be placed into a 65-gallon poly overpack.
